website_summaries.verdict: The Moto 360 tries to be the ultimate smartwatch, but it just ends up being a better-looking Android Wear watch with some notable limitations.
pros: The Moto 360's distinctive round design and premium materials look sharp
It's lightweight and comfortable, and it doubles as a bedside clock with its clever included inductive charging cradle
cons: Its battery life is not good enough for a watch
Its Android Wear software is awkward and not entirely useful, its fitness features are lacking, and its round display has a weird black bar at the bottom

customer_reviews.title: It just didn't last.
customer_reviews.text: I've had this watch for under a year now and feel it's about time I did a review. Unfortunately, the watch screen has suffered and has turned half yellow. I'm disappointed that it really didn't make it a year, but it would appear that I may be partially to blame. The yellow area of the screen appears to come from the hottest spot on the watch while it's charging and I had a habit of leaving it on the charger over night. Out of all my smart watches it remains the sleekest. I'll continue to use it off and on but mostly it'll just decorate my shelf now.
customer_reviews.author: Wilfredo V.

customer_reviews.title: Not bad for a while but then...
customer_reviews.text: I finally decided to take the plunge. I'd seen this watch at the local "big box" store. It wasn't hideous- not really much bigger than other regular analogue watches. It was fine for the first couple months. It was cool to get notifications on my wrist. Then after the last "update" it continuously reminds me to "download the motobody app for the full experience." I downloaded the "motobody" app (it's awful by the way). The watch STILL reminds me to download the app. I have to keep clearing the stupid reminder. Really annoying. It certainly changed the "full experience." The watch is now in the drawer and the Timex is back on the wrist.
customer_reviews.author: Farnorthtx

customer_reviews.title: disapointed in the band
customer_reviews.text: My band started pulling apart (the layers) almost 2 months after I got it. Now it's over a year old and it's pulled apart more. Hard to swallow when I paid what I paid for the watch. I would expect the band would not start to separate that quickly, not even after several years. I have another watch that is not a smart watch that I paid 50 bucks for that I wore for 3 years and the band is still in tact. Leather type band, very much like this style and it has not pulled apart. very disappointed. I don't feel I should have to replace a watch band 2 months after I got a new watch.
customer_reviews.author: Ren

customer_reviews.title: Can't beat the price.
customer_reviews.text: I know that this is a 1st Gen product and would not be fair to compare to any new watches. So, I'm comparing it to my Gear 2 that came out around the same time. When I got the 360 I cannot believe how much of a big difference that it would be. It was better than my Gear 2 in all ways possible, except battery life. My Gear 2 got about 2-3 days battery life but was too bland for me after awhile. The 360 on the other hand gets about 1-2 days after the Marshmallow update. The 360 also has better looks and more faces being it is Android Wear.
customer_reviews.author: Haksopharith Si

customer_reviews.title: Functional and stylish
customer_reviews.text: Cons that still don't take away stars: 1. No speaker, so it's impossible to make phone calls via the watch (unlike some competititors) 2. Flat tire digitizer - how they didn't figure this out in their design team even with gen 2 of the watch (when everyone else did), is still beyond me 3. "Always on" is not always on, but for about 5-10 seconds. My battery is at about 30% at the end of the day, so I'd rather have the always on for longer instead of sometimes trying to flip my wrist like an idiot to see the time.
customer_reviews.author: Natasha

customer_reviews.title: Not At All What Was Promised
customer_reviews.text: Within just the first few minutes of use, I was already seeing the problems other users were complaining about. The watch would not hold charge and would randomly stop charging. It would also randomly disconnect with no sign as to why. These issues combined with the fact that the heartbeat monitor seemed nonfunctional and that Android Wear seemed to not cooperate with the watch (most likely due to the connection issues), this item by no means was worth the price paid for it. Note: The item also arrived in packaging that had looked used and beat up, making me wonder if the device was really new at all...
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: One of the Best
customer_reviews.text: I purchased the Champagne Gold color and I have gotten SO many compliments on this watch. I love it a lot. Paired with my Samsung Galaxy Note 4. Even when I'm in a different room, it generally still stays connected. I love being able to change my music, read emails/texts, find out who's calling me - all without having to whip out my giant phone. If I had one complaint, it's that my pedometer stopped working on it - I'm guessing it's some feature that automatically disables if you're not really looking at it often. Overall excellent product, super happy with it.
customer_reviews.author: mrsmime100

customer_reviews.title: Terrible battery life
customer_reviews.text: The watch is cool and functions well but the battery life is horrible. I'm only getting about 6 hours before I need to charge it and that's with minimal power usage. I don't know how people claim they get 18 hours out of the battery... Maybe mine is defective (eh'em seller feedback). Really disappointed I can't even make it through a single 8 hour work day before the watch dies.
customer_reviews.author: k-town

customer_reviews.title: OG 360 is the best looking smartwatch!
customer_reviews.text: I bought this on sale for a Benjamin and a half from warehouse deals, and it was as good as new. It was like someone opened the package and then closed it and sent it back. For that price, it's been a really nice smartwatch. Fit and finish are excellent and I often get compliments on it. As for Android Wear, it's been good on this watch since the Marshmallow update. It's much smoother now. Battery life could be better but it lasts an entire day with lots of use, I just need to charge it nightly.
customer_reviews.author: C. Costa

customer_reviews.title: Dont buy warehouse deals.
customer_reviews.text: The watch is great for a 1st gen android wear iteration. The 6.0 update breathes new life into the old hardware and makes the watch a viable prospect, once again, as a first device for any buyers looking to try smartwatches while keeping pricing low. My own experience with amazon has all but tainted my perception on this particular device but i will not let that impact the positives in this review. (I received a cracked watch from warehouse deals) All in all, this is a great buy but please buy it new.
customer_reviews.author: Devon

customer_reviews.title: Love it.
customer_reviews.text: I tried the Samsung Gear watch and didn't like the way it looked of felt. Very cheap feeling and frankly it did more than a watch needs to do, i.e. who needs a camera in their watch? This Moto 360 on the other hand is great looking and does everything I need it to. I don't understand the blank spot at the bottom of the watch face, I'm sure the Moto engineers have a good explanation for why it needed to be there, but it doesn't look right. I wish the battery life was better as well, but over all for $200 it is a great watch.
customer_reviews.author: bbiggio

customer_reviews.title: Enthusiasticly recommended.
customer_reviews.text: I bought this Moto 360 as a gift for my wife. She is a die-hard Android affictionato; perhaps that helped her get it up and running in approximately 30-45 minutes. It is definitely an attractive watch and a competent smart watch too. I think the newer Moto 360 models and versions incorporate some worthwhile improvements and upgrades, but she has been very happy with this one.
customer_reviews.author: microdoc

customer_reviews.title: Dishonest seller
customer_reviews.text: This seller sent a watch with a defective band that didn't even had a clip to attach it to you wrist. This should never have happened as the defect was obvious, but the accepted a return and sent another. That one fell off of my wrist after a few weeks when the clip detached from the watch at one end. Annoyed with the prospect of another return, I got it re-attached at the mall. The jeweler said that the fix might not work and it didn't. Tried another jeweler, lasted about a month. Two watches, both defective. Draw your own conclusion.
customer_reviews.author: Irwin Udell

customer_reviews.title: ... has changed the way that I interact with my smart phone. The strap was a perfect fit but ...
customer_reviews.text: This device has changed the way that I interact with my smart phone. The strap was a perfect fit but I appreciate the extra chain sections included just in case. No problems with it so far and it does tend to get attention when I wear it. The integrated Google Fit functionality is nice for accountability. I was already active before but slowed down a bit following a car accident. The nagging from the watch that I haven't met my daily goal for walking is great motivation. Looking forward to future support as new updates will bring wifi and other goodies to these devices.
customer_reviews.author: Kalu Ude

customer_reviews.title: Slowes down after a few months
customer_reviews.text: It worked great when I first got it, but now its super sluggish, gps directions likes to not work, and the "ok google" mic feature is hardly accurate. I still wear it every day, but it could definitely be better.
customer_reviews.author: Casey

customer_reviews.title: The worst watch possible.
customer_reviews.text: I purchased this watch and for the first 6 months it was fine then all of a sudden the screen just started going black after having it on for 10 minutes put it back on the charger it would reboot and says the charges at 100% I put the watch back on 5 minutes later screen goes black this is the worst watch ever created Motorola should give every one of their customers a refund or some sort of recall needs to be done on these watches I don't know what generation I have but it really doesn't matter I bought another Smartwatch and it works perfectly the Moto 360 was a horrible investment
customer_reviews.author: Martin K. Green

customer_reviews.title: High Tech Classical Watch
customer_reviews.text: Beautiful Watch! I bought a champagne gold metal band model. It's antique look brass like material, little heavy but has the class. Android Wear OS is still need improvement.
customer_reviews.author: kenwinning

customer_reviews.title: I really like this watch
customer_reviews.text: I really like this watch. The battery life is about 18 hours for me. I like the ability to change watch faces. I have found that the watch charges in about an hour from 35%. The watch helps me with phone calls. I got the light metal band. It look nice and more important is that it is a good quality band. I did have to take the band to a jewelry shop to have it adjusted. I have added some third party watch faces and it has worked out great.
customer_reviews.author: SAM in AZ

customer_reviews.title: Does exactly what I want it to do. Battery lasts for 2 days!
customer_reviews.text: I originally bought an LG smart watch before buying this but returned it because it was way too expensive and the battery wasn't very good. Then I saw this on sale and grabbed it one day. I love this watch! With the new update, the battery lasts for up to 2 days on a charge. It also understand everything I want it to do and has lots of fun and useful apps on it. Best of all, with the new traffic laws, this watch makes it easy to quickly check messages, directions, and emails without pulling out your phone. I highly recommend it.
customer_reviews.author: Andrew McGarity

customer_reviews.title: Great, although it needs a strap link
customer_reviews.text: Excellent watch. At last a smart watch that does look like a watch. I'm not giving 5 starts, simply because it needs a link on the strap to make it look better, and avoid rear case cracking. I haven't cracked mine yet, but I'll be purchasing the 3rd party link from SteelConnect, although I believe Motorola should have included it. They are a bit on the expensive side. Other than that, battery life is getting better with time. I'm now approaching 3 days of battery life. A key is to turn it off at night.
customer_reviews.author: MartinO

customer_reviews.title: Couldn't be happier! Great product, love it!
customer_reviews.text: Absolutely love it! Got it for my birthday, and still going through all the options it has, but love it already. I am a very active person, love running and jogging. it is a great match for my Samsung S6. it does all the stuff the description says. Also got so many complements about the looks of it, my girlfriend returned her Samsung watch and got this one instead after using mine for a day. so dont hesitate get it, it is a good product and a very nice price, well, for the type of stuff:))
customer_reviews.author: Elena

customer_reviews.title: but honestly I just don't like the watch - it's like having your phone open ...
customer_reviews.text: Certain bugs such as that I could not change the face to custom ones I created, music didn't work, nor did heart rate, and a few other gripes. It needs more time to be fully polished, maybe v2 corrected for this. I didn't take off stars for this, but honestly I just don't like the watch - it's like having your phone open and on you 24/7 and it drove my totally mad. As a millennial I live and die by my phone, but there are times it's just too much.
customer_reviews.author: aeee

customer_reviews.title: Nice watch. Works well
customer_reviews.text: Nice watch. Works well. There are two issues that are not perfect. I want to monitor my heart rate in real time but I have to ask for the reading to get it. Maybe another app will get that worked out. the other reason is that there is learning curve as there is no quick start manual for the app part of the watch. It has a nice look. The face is big and has good response to touch. The "OK, Google" function works well. I have yet to try out all the apps.
customer_reviews.author: Doctor Go

customer_reviews.title: Beautiful, well crafted....... a bit gimmicky to me
customer_reviews.text: The Moto 360 is a beautiful, top quality made smartwatch. Mine died after a couple of weeks of use, but I'm sure this was an anomaly. What I didn't get was the usefulness of a smartwatch. That it vibrates on my wrist? That I can, in a very limited way read my messages on it? I'm sorry. I'd still rather use my smartphone. It's still gimmicky at this point. It's beautiful. The capacity to switch and design faces is a big plus and the watch is really well made. It tells time perfectly too. Just don't expect much more than that.
customer_reviews.author: Heri Scheker

customer_reviews.title: Buy it Already!
customer_reviews.text: I absolutely love my new gadget, i am no expert but i honestly cant live without this watch. i was quite scared about the battery life but i am soo glad i took the plunge, it is really not as bad as everyone makes it out to be. I did so much research before i decided to settle on this, no matter what other devices i researched i just kept coming back to this one. My advice? Buy it already.
customer_reviews.author: chichi

customer_reviews.title: Killer add on for Android phones!
customer_reviews.text: Awesome piece of add on gear for Android phones. UPDATES ARE A MUST! When it arrives, download Android Wear from Play Store and sync watch. Place it on charger and let the updates get installed first. After updates, this watch is the coolest thing you can have on your wrist. Lasts all day (6 am - 11 pm for me) and every update sent out makes it better and better!!
customer_reviews.author: J. Gahary

customer_reviews.title: Works great! Two large cons
customer_reviews.text: Works great! Two large cons, (1) slows down considerably with more apps (completely understandable) but no way I can figure out to delete an app from the watch and not your phone. (2) No longer being supported with software updates. If you are not interested in the newest features, however, this is a great watch to choose I think. The "flat tire" is not nearly as bad as it seems and is actually preferred for me.
customer_reviews.author: Justin Sheehan

customer_reviews.title: Awesomeness on Your Wrist
customer_reviews.text: This is the coolest gadget currently out. It is alot more durable than I thought. Which is great because I am a Kennel Technician so durability is a must. It makes manhandling my note 4 mostly unnecessary. The only three downsides I know of is voice to text is about 80% accurate, it times out if your sending a message longer than a sentence and the battery life last me a half day. It was packaged securely, and I received it in about 3 days. Overall, I am happy with this purchase!
customer_reviews.author: Tiffany

customer_reviews.title: Would not recommend Motorola
customer_reviews.text: Liked the watch originally. However after a couple of years it stopped working. I called Motorola to ask for battery repair and they told me they do not support the watch any more. All I was asking for is repair. Conversely, I have an iPhone 6S Plus that is six years old and I still get GREAT customer service
customer_reviews.author: Jim Argussa

customer_reviews.title: may not be the greatest battery life (barely makes it through a day with ...
customer_reviews.text: may not be the greatest battery life (barely makes it through a day with ambient on), but I do like getting all of my notifications through the watch. It doesn't look bad (although I also wish the flat tire wasn't a 'thing'), and you can install so many faces on this it's ridiculous, most of which are free. you should look into watchmaker or facer for apps to change the faces, and there are multiple websites with free watch faces available.
customer_reviews.author: your mother

customer_reviews.title: good except...
customer_reviews.text: I love the watch. It looks great. Feels great. But there is a few issues. I got the watch very quickly. But. The band was to small i have an 8.5 to 9 inch wrist. But thats okay. They send you extra links. But the issue that bothers me the most is the fact that it doesnt work. It will not stay connected to my galaxy note 4 longer then 3 minutes. Not even long enough to update the darn thing. I love the watch just wish i could get it to work.
customer_reviews.author: austin parison

customer_reviews.title: Now its the best time to buy a 360
customer_reviews.text: Now that the second generation is being released the watch is priced at only 150$ and for your entry into android wear this is the sweet spot. Great quality stainless steel it comes with extra links for sizing. Android wear has cone a long way since it launched so either if you are new to the SmartWatch scene and don't want to spend 300$+ or wasn't convinced with the motor 360 when it launched last year, now is the time to get it.
customer_reviews.author: Enrique Rivera Pizzati

customer_reviews.title: Best of the first gen smart watch in my opinion
customer_reviews.text: Once you put it on its really nice I have a big wrist and it fit me perfect. What i mean by that is big faced watch. The metal band comes out of the box for what i assume is a ladys wrist it comes with extra pieces that you can ad but get your self a watch repair kit with the tools you will need .Downside the way the strap is connected to the underside of the watch causes the plastic underneath to Crack look it up
customer_reviews.author: CW54

customer_reviews.title: Great watch. My only issue is more with Android ...
customer_reviews.text: Great watch. My only issue is more with Android Wear and the use of notifications. If you use notifications (which I do), Android Wear provides not mechanism to dismiss all of them at one time. So if your notifications pile up, you end up wiping over and over again to dismiss each one. That should be fixable in an update to the OS. But the physical watch itself is very nice.
customer_reviews.author: David B. Craine

customer_reviews.title: It's a wonderful thing to look at
customer_reviews.text: It's a wonderful thing to look at. Fits well with taking links out like a real Watch. Looks better than all other smart watches. With updates 6.0+ new breathe is put into these older watches. Love it! Battery Life could be better if you are an Active Athlete. But for your casual it will last days on charges. Power users go perhaps Version 2 for better life.
customer_reviews.author: angelforever101

customer_reviews.title: Very Disappointed - Piece of Trash!!!
customer_reviews.text: I am very disappointed with this product. I specifically bought it to track my activity and heart rate and it does not register either of these and causes much frustration! Update - this watch is a piece of trash! I did an hour Cross fit work out and it didn't track a single minute. I just did 42 minutes of interval running and it tracked 18 minutes!!$
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: What technology should be
customer_reviews.text: I've been using this watch for a few weeks now and I wear it everyday. I wasn't planning on wearing it everyday when I bought it but it has given me good reason to. This watch is what technology should be; it keeps track of everything and provides information at-a-glance but does not intrude. Battery life is fantastic even with heavy usage but it can get a bit warm if you really use it a lot. Otherwise it is there when you need it but you can ignore it if you want.
customer_reviews.author: Jason F

customer_reviews.title: Buy It for $140 or Less
customer_reviews.text: Excellent Android Wear choice for $140. The style is a 10 and functionality is 7. The "flat-tire" display doesn't bother me at all and the overall software experience is satisfactory. The wireless charger is very nice. I get about 16 hours of use on a single charge. I wouldn't say this gadget is worth more than $140, but at this price, it's worth it.
customer_reviews.author: Dan-O

customer_reviews.title: Don't buy
customer_reviews.text: Turns off on it's own. I gave it away just for the person to give it back cuz it wouldn't stop syncing. I don't recommend. I do recommend the Samsung Galaxy active 2. Plus the band was very worn. They could've at least put a new band on for Tyne amount it was.
customer_reviews.author: theresa wadsworth

customer_reviews.title: Get it!
customer_reviews.text: Everybody here has said everything amazing about this watch. I have nothing to add. It is really wonderful and when it broke, because I didn't notice that it can go only 1 meter under water, I couldn't spend a week without getting another one. The only thing is that I am looking for the bigger size now (46mm) because this one looks small on my wrist.
customer_reviews.author: Mohamed Hossam Khedr

customer_reviews.title: so the band and spring bar tear off easily and after three new spring bars and two repairs
customer_reviews.text: Build quality is questionable. The part where the spring bar connect the band to the watch is made of plastic, so the band and spring bar tear off easily and after three new spring bars and two repairs, the watch can no longer be worn because it ripped off again and the plastic no longer holds the spring bar. It's a shame, because I loved everything else about this watch!
customer_reviews.author: Watch_guy

customer_reviews.title: Great watch, bad battery
customer_reviews.text: Its a great watch, but the batter on it dies SOOOO fast. I almost have to carry the charger with me. It may just be my watch in particular, but I feel as if it dies so fast. The only way I get it to survive at work, is putting it on airplane mode while I work. Though I bashed the battery, the interface, and apps on the watch are amazing!
customer_reviews.author: Mitchell S.

customer_reviews.title: Not water resistant
customer_reviews.text: I bought this as a Christmas gift, few months past and I started to go to the gym and the moisture of my boddy builded up inside the watch, now the screen looks funny inside and i dont know how to fix it, there's even a dark spot at the top of the screen, no wonder it was discontinued by Motorola
customer_reviews.author: Kevyn

customer_reviews.title: Above and beyond my expectations!
customer_reviews.text: This watch exceeded my expectations! The screen is clear and bright. The battery life is excellent. By the end of the day it's still at 70%. Once you download the app to sync it with your phone it updates with more apps than I imagined. I love the wireless charging capability. And it comes with 4 extra links which was a blessing because I got it for my husband and he is a big man. He loves the fact that it still looks like a regular watch and he has gotten many compliments on it from his coworkers.
customer_reviews.author: mdavis2010

customer_reviews.title: Very satisfied
customer_reviews.text: I have had this for a while now and I love it. I don't usually like leather bands because they usually start to stink, because I am active and sweat a lot, but this one does not! And the watch is exactly what I expected. Once I modified the bottom of the watch to ensure I don't crack the back it is perfect.
customer_reviews.author: Mr. Joe

customer_reviews.title: Very underwelmed.
customer_reviews.text: It displays that it needs to be charged when there is still 40% left on the battery life indicator and stops functioning. It shows that text messages are sent however the recipient ie my cel phone never received any messages. Wait a few years until the technology improves... and this was supposed to be one of the better brands. Battery dies within 5 hours not 10 and that's with barely using the product as I said texting was unsuccessful.
customer_reviews.author: ChuckBack

customer_reviews.title: Cracked back issue
customer_reviews.text: After two months of using, battery dead and shows cracked back on the back side screen. Called Motorola for getting replacement. Representative wanted to charge me 100 dollar for getting replaced with new one.I had to call customer service 3 times to get a person willing to help me out for free replacement. Optioned to pay 24 dollars for faster processing. otherwise, it will take more than 1 month to get a new one.
customer_reviews.author: LiSal

customer_reviews.title: Not holding Charge.
customer_reviews.text: Good day. This item was purchased and given as a gift. The item is a beautiful watch however it has stopped working. It doesn't hold the charge once it's off the charger. The display lights up when it on the charger but goes completely black once it's taken off. Disappointed with the purchase. Reached out to the vendor/Amazon and have not had any response. Very disappointed with this transaction.
customer_reviews.author: Dave A. Mitchell

customer_reviews.title: Nice Design. Works Good
customer_reviews.text: Nice Design. Works Good. ANYWAY***** I Found THE ANSWER of disconnecting problem after 5.1.1 android phone. Read: !topic/android-wear/2TNfBytnVU8 And follow "Miles111". Even I solved that problem, I give only 3 starts. Cuz that solution was really hard to find.
customer_reviews.author: LookOut

customer_reviews.title: Best smartwatch STILL
customer_reviews.text: Best smartwatch STILL! As of July 2017 nothing comes close to the design. Love the simplicity yet elegant look of this watch. Still working great. I've had this for a while now. I have over 60+ watch faces. Can customize with any type of watch face. Download a software that can give you hundreds of options. Have fun.
customer_reviews.author: Lion Ali

customer_reviews.title: Good
customer_reviews.text: Ok, so it's been a week with the moto 360 Sliver and it working quite fine, battery life isn't the best but u will get a good 8hrs out of it. Watch charges very fast in under 2hrs your good to go again. It does take long to charge the first couple for charges but its quite fine the battery just needs to be calibrated. Very good buy.
customer_reviews.author: Nathanial Peters

customer_reviews.title: This is a great watch to be sure
customer_reviews.text: This is a great watch to be sure, it looks great and functions well. And the waterproofing is a life saver! However, don't buy this if you are looking for something akin to a cell phone. This is an accessory for sure. For what it is, being an excellent watch, I give it 4 stars. My only concern is the weight and clunky adjustment system.
customer_reviews.author: Jordan

customer_reviews.title: Great quality and very good looking
customer_reviews.text: Great quality and very good looking. I bought this because I have to keep my phone on quite while at work but hate missing important calls and texts. The vibrate is strong enough to feel. I enjoy the step counter, it gives me a goal to hit everyday. Very easy to use and fun. I get compliments on the looks all the time.
customer_reviews.author: pattiecake

customer_reviews.title: Love!
customer_reviews.text: So happy I repurchased this item. I got a refurbished last year & it didn't even make a year before the battery exploded out the back. This time I went new & so worth it. With the refurbished, he could BARELY get 1 day out of the battery. I think he now averages 7 days without having to recharge it!
customer_reviews.author: Gypsy

customer_reviews.title: Beware of the women's band if you have man-hands.
customer_reviews.text: I purchased this on a "treat-yo-self" occasion, but when I received it it didn't fit around my wrist. To be fair, I didn't notice that it came with additional links before I packaged it back up to return it. I do admittedly have very large wrists/hands for a woman (man-hands, honestly), so I wasn't super surprised that it didn't fit. However, it should be noted that when I bought the men's 23mm watch, it also barely fit my wrist with the already attached links. Beware of the women's band if you have man-hands.
customer_reviews.author: Grace

customer_reviews.title: Its a smart choice...still relevant
customer_reviews.text: Its consistent, reliable, and fun. Till this day people keep coming up to me asking if its the new apple watch... I'm like NO, its better!!! Honestly, there is no point to buy the more expensive android wears when they all are using the same software upgrade. Wait another two years when this watch can't handle or keep up with the software before being a more expensive version.
customer_reviews.author: Zizi

customer_reviews.title: It's Good!
customer_reviews.text: I like how it reminds me to "take a walk" after sitting still for a few hours. All the push notifications from your phone can be annoying but also turned off. Making custom watch faces is fun. I'm currently using my own face as a face. Hopefully future builds will include more rugged materials like Sapphire Crystals and Waterproof!!
customer_reviews.author: Glenn Smooth

customer_reviews.title: worked for 1 month and a week.
customer_reviews.text: Button stop working after I tested the water resistant part of it. Other than the battery life it's really nice. Edit: June 2, 2015 to July 17,2015... best paper weight ever
customer_reviews.author: Alien006

customer_reviews.title: Love the design and notifications work wonders (didnt expect that)
customer_reviews.text: Love the design and notifications work wonders (didnt expect that), also like the various watch faces to download. built is nice and high quality although after one drop the back surface glass had some small crack. Front is steadier but recommend to paste a tempered glass protector, mine had some minor scratches during this year. i recently changed to iphone, while android wears works on it fine, the feathers are reduced in functionality but this is not restricted to moto 360.
customer_reviews.author: EL

customer_reviews.title: Five Stars
customer_reviews.text: I LOVE IT! beautiful! i think the size is for women hands
customer_reviews.author: Ana Isabel

customer_reviews.title: Glad I bought this item
customer_reviews.text: Glad I bought this item. Love the looks of the watch and fits good. Arrived fast. Battery on this watch last all day for me. After using it off and on all day, by the time I go to bed to recharge it, it has 40% battery still. Great watch.
customer_reviews.author: Rachel

customer_reviews.title: Beautiful watch, pathetic battery life, so so software
customer_reviews.text: I give it 3 stars only because of the battery life. I got it for cheap so it's ok. Will never pay full price for this. I hear that the Moto 360 2 has fixed the problems of the 1st gen. Hardware wise, it's the most beautiful Android Wear out there. Software wise, not yet fully baked. That's on you, Google
customer_reviews.author: Chinoy Antonio

customer_reviews.title: Great watch with small battery
customer_reviews.text: Works as intended there is a market for android wear with tons of free apps and watch faces, rated at 4 stars because of battery life... i use it mainly for notifications of emails, calls and meetings however after 8 hours it will have max of 40% which wouldn't last till night so at the best case with regular use it will last for one day, i would have been much comfortable if a charge would last 2-3 days
customer_reviews.author: Hesham

customer_reviews.title: I was very skeptical about smart wearables since I recently had two Garmin vivosmarts which ...
customer_reviews.text: I was very skeptical about smart wearables since I recently had two Garmin vivosmarts which lasted a total of one month combined (Thank you amazon for the refund). However, I have been completely satisfied with my purchase of the moto 360. First of all, it's very stylish and not overly large. All the functions work as advertised, and with the recent upgrades to the operating system, the device keeps getting better and more user friendly. Don't let the battery life complaints scare you off, after a full day of use (6am - 10pm) I have 40-50% battery life remaining with all notifications on and screen brightness on it's brightest setting. Well worth the purchase.
customer_reviews.author: Michael Ratliff

customer_reviews.title: After almost a year. It's still an eye catcher
customer_reviews.text: Have them for less than a year & have not had any issues at all. It's very useful especially when you're driving & get a phone call. You see who's calling & can reply by tapping a pretext message. I still get compliments every now and then. Very pleased with purchase.
customer_reviews.author: RON

customer_reviews.title: Motorola Moto 360 - Light Metal, 23mm, Smart Watch ***Discontinued by Manufacturer***
customer_reviews.text: Fantastic looking watch and at a great price and I am sure that I will soon be upgrading to the next version based on my experience with this model. If you are looking for a smart watch then I would definitely recommend looking at this model whilst it is still available at this price.
customer_reviews.author: TekDek

customer_reviews.title: Okay
customer_reviews.text: I bought this watch refurbished. It didn't last long. It probably lasted for about 4 months.
customer_reviews.author: Erick

customer_reviews.title: Waste of money stopped working
customer_reviews.text: Stop working after 3 months. I would buy. Too late for refund don't waste your money!
customer_reviews.author: Shanel

customer_reviews.title: Bulky
customer_reviews.text: Feels more like a ball and chain for your wrist than a watch but it does work.
customer_reviews.author: Bob Weasly

customer_reviews.title: Great product!
customer_reviews.text: Watch works well. There were two updates that had to be installed right away, and not installing them was a mistake. Without them, the battery drained incredibly quickly, and in order to install them, you had to have at least 80% battery level. I had to wait for it to charge up, then install the update. After installation though, the battery life improved greatly!
customer_reviews.author: Evan Roden

customer_reviews.title: Like it just fine and does what it does quite well. No need to buy the $300 upgrade.
customer_reviews.text: Had mine for a couple of weeks now and glad I got this model . I know the watch's limitations and like it for what it is. My phone is always in my pants pocket and often I miss calls because at the time I could not get my phone out of my pocket fast enough. I can see why I am getting a notification vibe with the flick of a wrist. Comfortable to wear and the battery gets me through the day. I like the fitness tracking features also.
customer_reviews.author: Richard D. Cuttineau

customer_reviews.title: Great smartwatch!
customer_reviews.text: Husband lives this watch and gets many compliments on it all the time! It also got the latest update to Marshmallow even though it's a first gen model. His moto got the update weeks before my Huawei watch as well. No speaker but functions as well as any watch running Android wear. Charging dock is also very easy to use and makes the watch a bedside clock face. Nice way to check out smartwatches as the price has came down considerable amount.
customer_reviews.author: Kindle Customer

customer_reviews.title: Five Stars
customer_reviews.text: We are happy that product. Battery that does not go only one day 's shortcomings , but it is a good product. It is a simple design. Better to change watch face for a change of pace is clever enough to make me happy. We are happy to buy at a price of preference.
customer_reviews.author: Jae Hyeong Lee

customer_reviews.title: Honestly the best smart watch
customer_reviews.text: Honestly the best smart watch. Very elegant steel, easy to set up and use. The screen is brilliant, great display and battery life. Overall its a neat and beautiful piece with plenty of features!
customer_reviews.author: Chef Eddie

customer_reviews.title: Buy it.
customer_reviews.text: I wasn't sure if i was going to like having a smart watch. Well, I do. I love this thing. It not only looks nice, it works well too. I pretty much use it to preview and clear notifications and phone calls without getting my phone out, to navigate through music and podcasts, for quick GPS on the golf course (Hole 19 app), and to tell time. If you turn ambient screen mode off, the watch will easily last 24 hours. Can't vouch for how well the pedometer and heart rate monitor work. Basically, if you are on the fence about this purchase, as i was, buy it.
customer_reviews.author: Jim Dutchak

customer_reviews.title: Great
customer_reviews.text: This watch is great alot better then what was thought for how old of a modle but my fiance loves it.
customer_reviews.author: Chrissy

customer_reviews.title: Best First Smart Watch Iteration
customer_reviews.text: The Moto 360 remains the staple smartwatch even several years after it's initial introduction. I would continue to recommend this product, as it's competitive price point makes it an attractive alternative to the newer iteration - the Moto 360 2nd Generation. My only grivences with this product were resolved in the 2nd generation, where with my initial purchase the watchband snapped off when exercising.
customer_reviews.author: dsemiraro

customer_reviews.title: but still a great watch. I was also worried about wearing it ...
customer_reviews.text: I haven't regretted buying this watch after trying to talking myself into it for a few months. I get several compliments on it every day and the battery lasts all day. I wish you could view your message threads on the watch, but still a great watch. I was also worried about wearing it to work and breaking the screen. It's very durable and hasn't gotten a scratch in the 5 months I've had it.
customer_reviews.author: Tyler Cammack

customer_reviews.title: Nice Smartwatch!
customer_reviews.text: I am loving this watch! It works great with my Note 5. I can see and respond to text and MMS messages without looking at the phone, and the heart rate sensor works fine. Everyone who sees it mentions on how cool of a watch it is. Definitely recommend.
customer_reviews.author: Gerry A

customer_reviews.title: Amazing gadget to add to your collection
customer_reviews.text: Amazing gadget to add to your collection. Very sharp display and when you add different faces it could look like a high end watch. I like the alerts and all the other health tracking g tools. Would be better if it had speaker to make phone calls.
customer_reviews.author: Maher Kadoura

customer_reviews.title: Moto 360 box is New and Sealed
customer_reviews.text: Nice watch with proper sealed packaging. But it took about 2 hrs to complete full charging. The watch can last for a day plus and you may need to do a charge again. In conclusion, although the battery doesn't last for 2 days but it is worth to wear because the Moto 360 really gives you a premium looks and have a good quality built.
customer_reviews.author: Louise K

customer_reviews.title: Great product, but......
customer_reviews.text: I bought this as a Mother's day gift and so far the product is a big hit with Mom. One thing though, it came with a European style transformer. I looked back through the order details and there was no mention of transformer plug style selection or that is was a European model. It was no big problem, as I happened to have a micro usb transformer to plug into the charging dock. It would have been nice to have the version I needed to charge it out of the box. Other than that the product is very nice.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Nice for the money
customer_reviews.text: The Motorola watch is a very good-looking watch has no external speakers so you cannot make a phone call on it or hear the other person. As much as I like it the first watch I had with play Pandora and make phone calls for the same price

customer_reviews.title: I'd hold off and get a galaxy watch or apple over this product for sure.
customer_reviews.text: As soon as I got the watch I plugged it in and it didn't hold a charge. I left it on for 2 days straight and still didn't hold a charge. I had to return thenprofuct.
customer_reviews.author: DrewW

customer_reviews.title: While my husband really liked the watch after 5 months it became a black ...
customer_reviews.text: While my husband really liked the watch after 5 months it became a black screen. Even though on the details there was a year warranty neither Amazon or Grand River Tech the company who sold through Amazon. I asked for repair or replacement and just got told by one to go to the other. I use to have good customer services with Amazon but this is the second time recently they have greatly disappointed me.
customer_reviews.author: cassandra acacia hovda

customer_reviews.title: Great Watch
customer_reviews.text: Not a simple problem with this watch, I used it almost every day and has replaced almost all of my watches except by my Suunto Core and Garmin Vivoactive. With the customizable and downloadable screens I can literally change every day the look of my watch from the minimalist to the most futuristic screen, just amazing! Sync is so easy with my smartphone
customer_reviews.author: Luis Gonzalez

customer_reviews.title: best watch for 2014 early 2015
customer_reviews.text: best Android wear watch out there. runs pure stock android, as supposed to the Samsung and lg watch that have a different os running on top of Android wear. what I love about this watch is it looks like a normal watch. can't wait to see what the next generation had in store.
customer_reviews.author: The Night King

customer_reviews.title: excellent watch for the price
customer_reviews.text: The metal band is excellent, exceeded my expectation in regards to quality. The watch has a decent weight to it and it feels very sturdy and it has the water and dust proof element that is not found in many other smart watches that are similarly priced.
customer_reviews.author: E.S.A.

customer_reviews.title: Amazing smart watch
customer_reviews.text: Easy to sync to my phone, battery is great, had it for a year and still wear it daily
customer_reviews.author: Erich Leyendecker

customer_reviews.title: It is good looking and for a good price
customer_reviews.text: If you don't want to expend too much in your first smartwach and you wanna give it a try.. This is what you are looking for. With the last software updates the battery reach to the end of the day without any problem. It is good looking and for a good price.
customer_reviews.author: Martin Zanotti

customer_reviews.title: Just the right purchase for technology purposes!
customer_reviews.text: Bought this for a special gift for my son. He actually picked it out after researching different products. He is very pleased with this watch and of course that make me happy, too. ;-)
customer_reviews.author: Lynn227

customer_reviews.title: Very nice watch with a sleek look and design definitely one ...
customer_reviews.text: Very nice watch with a sleek look and design definitely one of the better looking smart watches out there! Am currently getting my head round the functionality and feel that it may be a little early for smart watches still since there are not as many apps as I would like. But anyways am happy with my purchase overall only comment being that I suspect the heart rate monitor is not that accurate, not sure if it is because of the apps or the watch itself as I am still trying to get my head around it (hence the 4 star versus 5 star).
customer_reviews.author: Cham Ho

customer_reviews.title: Design is very cool. This models look like analog watch
customer_reviews.text: At first,this is most interesting gadget for me in 2015. Design is very cool. This models look like analog watch. It is important to adapt to fashion. Basic functionality is better. It is a sufficient performance as current Android wear. I hope that this will be released in Japan. But,there is a unfortunate point. It is "COLOR" Color is written "champagne metal "at motorola's HP in my memory. But I felt it is gold metal when I opened. Visual performance of color may be difficult theme.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: LOVE IT!
customer_reviews.text: LOVE IT! I just love everything about this watch! I bought it in October but didn't have a compatible smartphone so I bought a OP3 and it works awesomely! The only thing that is not so good is the battery life, but if I disable the fitness sensors and apps and set it to only display when I touch it, then the battery would last all day!
customer_reviews.author: William Sanchez

customer_reviews.title: More than expected
customer_reviews.text: This watch is more what I expected it to be. At first it had a huge baterry problem, but after about two weeks it skyrocketed, and now I can go through an entire day (with ambient display on) and still have some juice left. The wear OS is just amazing and I am suprised with what you can do nowadays just with your watch. Even though it is the first gen. from 2014, it is still up for everything. I haven't experienced any lag, just a few app crashes, but it wasm't the watch's fault.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Kunde

customer_reviews.title: Good watch. Android wear does need a bit more work though.
customer_reviews.text: Pros: Nice design. Looks good on the wrist. Easy to use. Build quality pretty good. Great conversation piece. Cons: A little bit thick but thats unavoidable. Does not work with iOS unfortunately. Gets warm and drains battery if it misses its notification cycle and starts to poll for the Android device. Wifi does not seem so useful. Heart rate monitor flaky and misses or does not read at all. Battery goes fast especially when its on BT or Wifi. Overall: Cant beat the price for its value. :) Good for daily use.
customer_reviews.author: JW Chan

customer_reviews.title: One of the more attractive Android Wear devices
customer_reviews.text: Pros: Attractive brushed aluminum design Android Wear is useful and has a growing library of apps Round display looks nicer than square on a smart watch Removable straps are nice Charging dock is great Cons: Mediocre battery life Low pixel density Slower than other 1st gen Android Wear watches Flat tire design
customer_reviews.author: SwarlesB

customer_reviews.title: I like it, its an older model now
customer_reviews.text: I like it, its an older model now, but if you just want simple notifications, its still pretty good. sad that it wont support wear 2.0
customer_reviews.author: Anthony Pagnotta

customer_reviews.title: I like this watch for the price .
customer_reviews.text: So far good watch . I use this Motorola smart watch every day .work ,gym, everywhere
customer_reviews.author: Chuchu

customer_reviews.title: Not Fully Water Resistant
customer_reviews.text: After about a year of owning this watch that CLAIMS to be IP67 water resistant, while just simply washing my hands under room temperature water, the watch then flooded with water and now cannot charge beyond 3%. This watch is honestly beautiful looking but the looks didn't match the watch’s water resistant claims and worse yet, the warranty does not cover any damage if the watch has been in contact with literally any liquid! Very Disappointing!
customer_reviews.author: Kaveer D.

product_meta.title: Motorola Moto 360 - Stone Grey Leather Smart Watch
product_meta.description:
Color:Stone Grey| Product Packaging:Standard PackagingMoto 360 is a modern timepiece powered by Android Wear. Comfortable, familiar, and crafted with the finest materials, Moto 360 keeps you up to date without taking you away from the moment. Glance at your wrist to see updates or just speak to get the info you need. Because it's time a watch told you more than just the time. What's Included: 

 * Motorola Moto 360 Smart Watch for Android Devices 4.3 or Higher
 * Wireless charging dock
 * Wall charger
 * Quick-start guide
feature_bullets: Quality craftsmanship - Finely crafted with stainless steel, genuine Horween leather and scratch-resistant glass.
Timely updates at a glance – Get both the time, and what that moment means to you
Responds to your Voice – Just speak to get the info you need
Tracks Health and Fitness – Moto Body tracks your steps, distance and calories burned along with your heart rate
Works with your AndroidTM phone – Pair with any smartphone running Android 4.3 or higher

specifications.Customer Reviews: 4.0 out of 5 stars1,942 ratings4.0 out of 5 stars
